text:
My name is
B.H. Barry.

I'm a fight
director.

The first impression of me is a
man of violence, of action.

But when they come into my
apartment and see the much

gentler side of me, I think it
says a lot more about who I

really am than what my
career says about me.

I spent most of my
life in the dark.

And what the apartment
represents is light.
It represents escape.

It represents just that
freedom

when you are trying to
get out of the city.

My wife is always getting
me to throw things out,

which I hate doing.
I love holding on to old things.

And she kept yelling at me about
getting rid of these T-shirts

and getting rid of these
T-shirts. And then eventually

they disappeared. I didn't know
what happened to them.

And guess what happened?
They all got made into

this beautiful quilt which
is a memory of all the shows

or, a lot of the
shows that I did.

And here they are in quilt form.
Looks pretty cool.

Let me say I am not
the greatest singer in the

world or the greatest ukulele
player in the world but what it

does whenever I pick it up, it
just makes me happy.

So if you want to sing along,
you can do.

Five foot two, eyes of blue. Oh,
what those blue eyes could do.

The African violets give me a
great deal of pleasure when I

look at them and see them
growing, I know life goes on.

Even when you think I'm dead,
I'm still alive.

So maybe it's about survival
that I enjoy most about them.
